Lithium-Ionen LFP.description: Lithium Iron Phosphate - Most common for residential storage

cost.cost_notes: Includes battery, BMS, inverter integration, installation. Prices vary by manufacturer and system size.

Lithium-Ionen LFP.notes:
- Most popular choice for residential storage
- Excellent safety characteristics
- Good cycle life
- Lower energy density than NMC but safer

Lithium-Ionen NMC.description: Lithium Nickel Manganese Cobalt - Higher energy density

cost.cost_notes: Higher energy density commands premium pricing. Prices vary by manufacturer.

Lithium-Ionen NMC.notes:
- Higher energy density than LFP
- Good for space-constrained installations
- Slightly shorter lifetime than LFP

Lithium-Ionen NCA.description: Lithium Nickel Cobalt Aluminum - Very high energy density

cost.cost_notes: Premium technology with highest energy density. Prices vary by manufacturer.

Lithium-Ionen NCA.notes:
- Highest energy density
- Shorter lifetime than LFP
- More expensive

cost.cost_notes: Premium technology with ultra-long cycle life. Higher cost but excellent durability.

Lithium-Ionen LTO.notes:
- Longest cycle life
- Excellent temperature tolerance
- Lower energy density
- More expensive

cost.cost_notes: Emerging technology with lower cost potential. Limited market availability in Switzerland. Prices may vary significantly.

Natrium-Ionen.notes:
- Lower cost than lithium-ion
- Abundant materials
- Emerging technology
- Lower energy density

cost.cost_notes: Traditional technology with lower upfront cost but shorter lifetime and lower efficiency. Less common in modern Swiss installations.

Blei-Säure AGM.notes:
- Lowest cost option
- Lower efficiency and cycle life
- Requires more maintenance
- Lower depth of discharge
- Heavier and larger than lithium-ion

notes:
This file contains technical specifications for battery storage technologies.

When a user selects a battery technology:
1. The corresponding parameters are automatically loaded
2. Degradation is calculated as: total_degradation / lifetime_years
3. Users can override individual parameters if needed

To add a new battery technology:
1. Add a new entry under battery_technologies
2. Include all required parameters
3. Follow the same structure as existing entries

Parameter Sources:
- Manufacturer specifications
- Industry standards
- Typical values from real-world installations
- May vary by manufacturer and specific product

COST DATA (Swiss Market 2024-2025):
⚠️  IMPORTANT: Cost data is based on market estimates and industry reports.

Cost per kWh includes:
- Battery cells/modules
- Battery Management System (BMS)
- Inverter integration
- Installation (typical residential)
- Basic permits

Cost factors that may vary:
- System size (larger systems may have lower cost per kWh)
- Manufacturer/brand
- Installation complexity
- Additional features (smart management, backup power, etc.)
- Regional variations within Switzerland

RECOMMENDATION:
- Verify costs with local Swiss suppliers/manufacturers
- Get quotes for specific projects
- Consider system size and installation requirements
- Factor in subsidies (Pronovo, cantonal bonuses)

Cost data should be updated regularly as battery prices evolve.
